#Text=INDIA.
#Text=Calcutta, Aug. 3.
#Text=—Favourable accounts are received from the famine districts ; the distress is abating and the crops arc thriving.
#Text=The Lieutenant-Governor left Calcutta on the 23rd ult. for the Assam districts.
#Text=The first session of the Bengal Social Science Association has been held.
#Text=It was attended with great success.
#Text=Its objects are the same as those of the English Association.
#Text=The Bishop of Calcutta is about to proceed on a visitation tour lasting nearly four months.
#Text=Cholera still prevails in the North-west Provinces of the Punjaub.
#Text=Bengal is reported healthy.
#Text=There is abundant rain, and the harvest prospects are good.
#Text=Bombay, Aug. 9.
#Text=—At the annual meeting of the shareholders of the Bank of Bombay the directors reported an additional loss of £530,000 of the banks capital, leaving £510,100 intact.
#Text=A resolution was adopted praying the Government to appoint a commission to inquire into the mismanagement of the bank.
#Text=The Poonah branch of the Bank of Bombay expected to lose between £20,000 and £30,000, principally on forced Government securities.
#Text=The amalgamation of the Banks of Bombay and Bengal has been abandoned, although applications for ever 1,500 shares have been registered.
#Text=The latest news from Cabul represents Afzul Khans position as very precarious.
#Text=It is expected that Cabul itself will soon fall into the hands of Ameer Shere Ali.
